data.title: debug coffeescript?
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0
- OS Version: ubuntu 14.04

Steps to Reproduce:
1.  add `"sourceMaps": true,` to launch.json
2. set a breakpoint in the coffeescript file.

The breakpoint doesn't trigger.  Does debugging coffeescript work if you have the sourcemap in the same directory?  I specify program as: `"program": "${workspaceRoot}/app.js"` should it be something else?

data.title: Why after one preLaunchTask run, vscode always states on subsequent runs that there are errors (only resets after you fully restart vscode)
data.body:
Why after one preLaunchTask run, vscode always states on subsequent runs that there are errors? This only resets if you fully restart vscode.
- VSCode Version: 1.1.0-insider
- OS Version: OSX 10.11

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Setup a C# dotnet core debuggable project, that you know compiles.
2. For debug purposes, set showOutput to always in tasks.json (for the task that the debugger runs)
3. Run dotnet build in the terminal to cache the compilation bits, so the output stays exactly the same for both times in the vscode output window.
4. Run the debugger, no error bar should appear and you should see `Project %name% was previously compiled. Skipping compilation.` in the output window.
5. Launch debug again, and again and watch ad nauseam as the error bar keeps appearing while the build was successful/had no errors.
6. To know for sure this error information stays cached somewhere just restart vscode and run debug, there will appear no error bar the first time, and it's there again the second.

Is this because the markerService does not get reset?

(Talking about the markerService in this class)
https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/parts/debug/electron-browser/debugService.ts

data.title: Debug seems to hang when calling a python script within my PowerShell scripts
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.0.0
- OS Version: Win 10 64bit, build 14328

Steps to Reproduce:

Hi,

I'm not sure if the is your bug or VSCode, so have posted to both.

I have a relatively simple PS script, but when I run a debug in VSCode, VSCode, seems to hang when invoking the Python script. However, if I set a break point (say on line 19 below), and press "pause", I see the output from the Python script in the Debug console and the breakpoint has been hit,

```
$ErrorActionPreference="SilentlyContinue"
Stop-Transcript | out-null
$ErrorActionPreference = "Continue"

$SnapsToTest = Get-ChildItem C:\Snaps\ -Directory
$ErrorFile = "C:\Tools\Scripts\Errors.txt"
$SnapDir = "C:\Logs"
$LogDir = "\var\log\"
$LogFile = "support.log"
$env:PYTHONIOENCODING="UTF-8"

Start-Transcript -path $ErrorFile
Push-Location
Set-Location -Path $SnapDir

$SnapsToTest | ForEach-Object {
        Write-Host $_.Name
        python C:\Tools\Scripts\script1.py $_.Name
        $LogToTest = $_.Name+$LogDir+$LogFile
        python C:\Tools\Scripts\script2.py $LogToTest
    }

Pop-Location
Stop-Transcript
```

data.title: Do not allow markers with no message to float through our system
data.body:
Possible sources:
- extension host @jrieken 
- tasks framework @dbaeumer 

Starting with extension host. I have seen we hit a lot #5325 in error telemetry. This is because we try to add a decoration for a marker that contains a `source` but does not contain a `message`. I also find it funny that `IMarker` is defined as `message:string` and we check if `Array.isArray(marker.message)` in there.

I have added a check on my side, but IMHO we should not have such markers in our system since they are useless or represent a bug somewhere else. My suggestion: throw or ignore invalid markers when they get added into the system.

data.title: Added .inl file extension to C++ language
data.body:
`.inl` files are one convention for C++ `.h`/`.hpp` files which contain code such as definitions of inline or templates functions.

It seems [this suffix is only used for these files](http://filext.com/file-extension/INL), so there should be no problems.

data.title: should we merge IMessageService#setStatusMessage and IStatusBarService?
data.body: We have a [IStatusBarService](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/services/statusbar/common/statusbarService.ts#L45) and [IMessageService.setStatusMessage](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/services/message/browser/messageService.ts#L135) which looks like duplication or re-exporting. Should we move the setStatusMessage feature into the status bar service?

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Ctrl+Shift+Alt+Down - default ubuntu hotkeys to move window to other desktop

I set Ctrl+Shift+D for me right now, but it will be nice to have OS dependency of hotkeys out of the box

data.title: Simplify suggest result
data.body: At some point, @jrieken, you mentioned there it no more need to return [an array of arrays of suggestions](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/editor/contrib/suggest/common/suggest.ts#L24), but one array would be enough. How can we get there?

data.title: Ability to dim git ignored files / folders

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
It would be nice to be able to dim files and folders that are listed in the .gitignore file.

I'm not sure if this has been mentioned or not, before, but I couldn't find anything about it.

It would make it easier to tell what is ignored, and what is in your actual repo. Plenty of times I have accidentally edited a transpiled file, wondering why my changes did get updated.

As an aside, file type icons would be cool, as well. I think this has been mentioned before, but put on the back burner because of the "Christmas Tree Effect". It would make finding files a bit easier, IMO. It could be off by default.

I've just started to look into the source of the project, and from what I understand, there isn't a way to access the explorer (sidebar) with an api. It would be nice to be able to create an extension for something like this. (also, It seems like themes do not have access to the explorer, either (except for light vs. dark). It looks kind of odd when the code pane is one color, and the explorer pane is another.

Sorry to run on, but I think these would be some good additions!

data.title: debt - is IContextViewService just hot air?
data.body: I see we have a [`IContextViewService`](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/platform/contextview/browser/contextView.ts#L16) and I see it being injected but somehow I don't anyone actually using it in the sense of calling methods except for the content _menu_ service.

data.title: Undo after save with trimTrailingWhitespace enabled moves cursor to beginning of file.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0 fa6d0f03813dfb9df4589c30121e9fcffa8a8ec8
- OS Version: OS X 10.11.3 (15D21)

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Enable trimTrailingWhitespace
2. Move the cursor down a few lines
3. Type in whitespace at the end of the line
4. Save
5. Undo

The cursor will jump to the beginning of the file.

data.title: Handle pasting code from column selection specially

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/1515#issuecomment-210166838

From @seva0stapenko

---

Tried column selection in VSCode 1.0. Well, rectangular selection does work, cutting and pasting back also works, but that's about it.
Cutting and pasting into a different part of the code does not work as expected. Both Notepad++ and VS remember that copied text was a rectangular block and paste it as a rectangular block.
VSCode treats copied block just like a regular text, so pasting it anywhere outside of the current multi-cursor context would create a mess.
It's good that the feature is being worked on, but it's not fully baked yet.

data.title: 'Unnecessary using directive' is falsely flagged when required for XML cref comments.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0
- OS Version: WIndows 10 Version 1511

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create a C# class.
2. Add an XML comment with `/// <see cref="SqlCommand.Parameters" />`
3. Add the using using `System.Data.SqlClient;` to the namespace.
4. The warning `Unnecessary using directive` appears.
5. This is in conflict to Visual Studio 2015 Community, where removing the using directive generates the warning `CS1574 XML comment has cref attribute 'SqlConnection' that could not be resolved`.

data.title: define what 'args' is in IKeybindingService#executeCommand
data.body: The keybinding services allows to manually invoke a command. The signature today is `executeCommand(commandId: string, args?: any): TPromise<any>;` but it is unclear what `args` is esp. w.r.t. multiple arguments and the type (there is some massaging going on).
